did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Music Images from the Pan-American Exposition, Buffalo, 1901

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The images in this collection include scenes of music venues at the Pan-American Exposition held in Buffalo in 1901, including the Temple of Music, the Midway, and bandstands. The collection also contains images of musicians who performed at the Exposition and musical instruments used at the Exposition.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Music Images from the Pan-American Exposition, Buffalo, 1901, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was compiled by Music Library staff in 2001 while creating the Music Library portion of the University at Buffalo Libraries exhibition, Illuminations: Revisiting the Buffalo Pan-American Exposition of 1901.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: Entire collection digitized and available in UB Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Music was an integral component of the activities provided at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo in 1901. The Temple of Music was the principal venue for music performance. It was designed by architect August C. Esenwein and featured an organ built by Emmons Howard. More than seventy renowned organists performed on the Temple instrument during the course of the Exposition.

Music was also performed at five bandstands located on Exposition grounds: the Plaza bandstand north of the Electric Tower, the East and West bandstands in the Esplanade near the Temple of Music and Ethnology Building, the Casino bandstand on the shore of the lake close to where the Casino building stands today, and another bandstand on the lake near what is now the Albright-Knox Art Gallery. The heavy schedule of band performances by more than twenty-six different bands kept these bandstands in almost constant use throughout the Exposition.

The Midway also served as a venue for performances of music, including an assortment of music from different cultures. These included representatives from Africa, the Middle-East, Hawaii, Mexico, Italy, Germany, and Puerto Rico. For many visitors to the Exposition, it was their first opportunity to experience anything of these cultures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains fifty images collected or reproduced for use in the Music Library exhibition, Music and Musicians at the Pan-American Exposition. This exhibition, displayed in the Music Library June-September 2001, was part of the larger, University Libraries exhibition, Illuminations: Revisiting the Buffalo Pan-American Exposition of 1901.

There are only four original items in the collection: two postcards of the Temple of Music, an informal photograph of the interior of the Temple of Music, and a digital photograph of the piano that was housed in the New York State Building, now the home of the Buffalo and Erie County Historical Society.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series:

The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

defitem.label: Pan-American Exposition Sheet Music Collection, 1899-1909 Mus. Arc. 8.2
defitem.item: Thirty-five titles of sheet music related to the 1901 Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo and one title related to an exposition held in 1905 in Buffalo. All but nine of the titles are photocopies of works in the Buffalo & Erie County Public Library.

label.extref: Music and Musicians at the Pan-American Exposition

defitem.item: Music portion of the larger exhibition, Illuminations: Revisiting the Buffalo Pan-American Exposition of 1901.
